color: #000000; font-family: 'Open Sans', Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; float: none;

br.br: WLCSC Schools are currently closed and utilizing eLearning & Remote teaching days on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday of each week. We have created this page as a central location for all resources and materials that will be needed throughout this unfortunate time. Please see the areas below for important information.

div.class: uk-grid-width-1-1 uk-grid-width-small-1-2 uk-grid-width-medium-1-2 uk-grid-width-large-1-2 uk-grid-width-xlarge-1-3 uk-grid uk-grid-match uk-text-left

div.p: Written by Brandon Hamilton on Monday, 06 April 2020. Posted in COVID-19

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 15px; padding: 0px; text-align: justify; color: #000000; font-family: 'Open Sans', Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;
p.strong:
Please view our FAQs and guidelines for parents and students here: Parent FAQs
WLCSC Continuous Learning Plan
Damaged Device? Need a device? WLCSC Device Repair Form
What is eLearning?
p.br: Indiana Department of Education (IDOE) established eLearning days in 2011 for organizational purposes and expanded the program to include inclement weather days in 2014 as a response to schools that had the ability to provide high-quality instruction digitally.

div.p: Written by Dr. Killion on Monday, 06 April 2020. Posted in COVID-19

p.span: Yesterday I sent out a communiqué indicating that we would hold 160 days of instruction using eLearning to get us to the end of the school year. Since then, I have received further guidance from the IDOE regarding instructional days. Schools can either hold 160 instructional days or implement 20 days of eLearning. In discussions with various groups, I am choosing the 20-day eLearning option for our school district. This will ensure we meet all IDOE requirements plus give the administration, teachers, and staff time to prepare for, if allowed, summer activities, and also time to plan for the 20/21 school year.

div.p: Written by Brandon Hamilton on Monday, 06 April 2020. Posted in COVID-19

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
p.span: WLCSC Is delivering food packages every Monday.

div.p: For up to date information on how you can stay safe during the outbreak, please visit the CDC website here: CDC COVID-19

br.p: It is the policy of the West Lafayette School Corporation not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability in its educational programs or employment policies as required by the Indiana Civil Rights Act, Titles VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Equal Pay Act of 1973, Title II, Title IX and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973. ” Questions and concerns should be directed to the Title IX, Title II, and Section 504 Coordinator as follows: Dr. Rocky D. Killion, Superintendent of Schools c/o West Lafayette School Corporation 1130 N. Salisbury St., West Lafayette, IN 47906 Phone: (765)-269-4002

br.br:
All schools will remain on a Monday, Wednesday, Friday
eLearning schedule through May 15th.
We have created a page under the COVID-19 heading to add additional information during this time.
Please visit that webpage here: wl.k12.in.us/covid-19
